meanings.sent1: The dragon will slay the knight in the story.
meanings.sent2: The assassin planned to slay the target silently.
meanings.sent3: The horror movie villain will slay all the unsuspecting teenagers.
meanings.sent4: The warrior will slay all obstacles in his path to victory.
meanings.sent5: The hunter's arrow will slay the deer with precision.

meanings.sent1: Her performance on stage will slay the audience with laughter.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's jokes never fail to slay the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The clown's silly antics never fail to slay the children at the party.
meanings.sent4: The magician's tricks will slay the audience with amazement.
meanings.sent5: The singer's powerful voice will slay the judges in the competition.

meanings.definition: To succeed in a big way
meanings.sent1: She will slay the interview and get the job.
meanings.sent2: The team's hard work will slay the competition in the tournament.
meanings.sent3: His innovative idea will slay the market and bring in profits.
meanings.sent4: The student will slay the exam with thorough preparation.
meanings.sent5: The entrepreneur's new product will slay the industry with its uniqueness.
